story.storybody:
Choicest euphemisms for getting fired

An HR invention that still hasnt found space in recognised dictionaries

A surplus, you thought? In corporate corridors that's the word to be wary of

Once a staple in chemistry labs, now it means, you no longer work for the company

RIFFED or Reduction-in-force. Means losing a job, for reasons beyond your control

MASTERS OF EUPHEMISM

Turn the pages of history for some memorable moments of doublespeak

Emperor Hirohito

"The war situation has developed not necessarilyto Japans advantage"

So the Japanese emperor informed his subjects of the country's unconditional surrender after being hit by A-bombs

Bill Clinton

"Didnt inhale"

When he admitted he had smoked marijuana but?er, not really. Caught oninstantly among students across campuses in US

Winston Churchill

"Perhaps we have been guilty of some terminological inexactitudes"

So said the British PM in 1906,denying the exploitation of Chinese coolies in South Africa

Adolf Hitler

"The Final Solution"

Or the systematic extermination of 6 million Jews, mentioned in a July 31, 1941, Nazi memo, after earlier plans of mass sterilisation and deportation to Madagascar failed

Silvio Berlusconi

"Final user"

His lawyer said since the ex-Italian PM had just slept with an escort, but didn't pay for the service, he was not criminally liable
